embed: <object width="640" height="390"><param name="movie" value="http://youtube.com/v/QcN_Hmh88mA?version=3&hl=en_US"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://youtube.com/v/QcN_Hmh88mA?version=3&hl=en_US" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="640" height="390" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>
summary:
In high school science, we're taught to always include units in equations. Why
not in scientific Python code? I'll show why and how to keep track of units in
Python using real-world examples.
title: Writing self-documenting scientific code using physical quantities
